message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.CC

This paper is about recognizing textual entailment (RTE) using a combination of syntactic and semantic analysis, logical inference, and ontological background knowledge. The paper focuses on natural language processing and machine learning techniques, which are typically covered in the arXiv category cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper uses automated reasoning tools and statistical models, which are relevant to the sub-categories cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the use of external sources like WordNet, YAGO, and OpenCyc, which are relevant to the sub-categories cs.IR (Information Retrieval) and cs.CC (Computational Complexity). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.CL, followed by cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.IR, and cs.CC.
